newsitem.title: PERU: Intrepid photographer flies over Peru siege site.
newsitem.headline: Intrepid photographer flies over Peru siege site.

text.p: Undeterred by stray bullets and scores of crack commandos, a daredevil Peruvian photographer flew in a fragile microlight craft over the still-smouldering Japanese ambassador's mansion just an hour after the hostage rescue.
Newspaper El Comercio said on Wednesday photographer Aroldo Horta flew in the small motorized microlight over the elegant mansion where Marxist rebels had been holding 72 VIPs hostage for 126 days.
Police detained Horta when he landed for questioning, but the photographer managed to hide his film and pass the pictures to the paper.

All 14 Tupac Amaru guerrillas were killed when Peruvian troops swarmed across walls and burst from secret tunnels to launch a spectacular attack on the diplomatic residence. One captive -- a local judge -- and two commandos were also killed in the assault.
